source.raw_text:
The Sandbag Row (Bent-Over) is a compound pulling movement targeting the upper back (traps, rhomboids, lats), with significant assistance from the biceps, forearms (grip strength), and shoulders, while the core, glutes, and hamstrings stabilize the whole body due to the shifting weight, building functional strength and improving posture. Its primary pattern is a hip hinge (like a deadlift) combined with a pulling/rowing motion, challenging stabilizer muscles more than rigid weights. [1, 2, 3, 4]  
Muscles Worked 

• Primary Movers (Pulling): 

    • Latissimus Dorsi (Lats): For pulling the bag towards the body. 
    • Trapezius (Traps): Mid and upper traps for shoulder blade retraction. 
    • Rhomboids: Between shoulder blades, crucial for scapular stability. 

• Assisting Muscles: 

    • Biceps & Forearms: For elbow flexion and intense grip strength due to the unstable load. 
    • Posterior Deltoids (Rear Shoulders): Help with pulling and stabilization. 

• Stabilizers (Core & Lower Body): 

    • Core (Abs, Obliques, Erectors): To prevent torso rotation and maintain a rigid spine. 
    • Glutes & Hamstrings: To support the hip hinge and keep the lower body stable. [2, 3, 4, 5, 6]  

Movement Patterns 

1. Hip Hinge: Bending at the hips with a slight knee bend, similar to a Romanian Deadlift (RDL), to pick up the bag. 
2. Pull/Row: Driving the elbows back and squeezing shoulder blades together to pull the bag to the torso. 
3. Scapular Control: Actively retracting and controlling the shoulder blades due to the sandbag's shifting weight, enhancing stability. 
4. Core Engagement: Constant tension to keep the torso stable and prevent rounding, making it a full-body functional movement. [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7]  

Key Benefits 

• Functional Strength: Mimics lifting awkward, real-world objects. 
• Enhanced Grip: Demands significant hand and forearm strength. 
• Improved Posture: Strengthens upper back and scapular stabilizers. 
• Core Stability: Forces intense core activation. [2, 3, 4]  

**Citations:**
